text: Thank you, @POTUS, for hosting today's roundtable on criminal justice reform. Prison commitments in GA are down nearly 20% since 2009, keeping more families together and communities intact. Watch the roundtable here: https://t.co/LATfHGdhGL (1/2)

I enjoyed meeting with @POTUS, @SecretaryPerry, @SecretaryAcosta, @GovMattBevin & others. In GA, commitments of young offenders are down 46% since 2014 and we’ve seen a 24% decrease in recidivism rates for those who complete vocational training programs while incarcerated. (2/2)

ICYMI: Yesterday I met with @POTUS, other governors, state attorneys general & federal leaders to discuss criminal justice reform. In Georgia, we are addressing barriers to successful reentry to reduce recidivism & make our communities safer. More here: https://t.co/NmwYKCVkZt https://t.co/HzrPJzHUrv
We are glad Georgia's on your mind. https://t.co/C7FWrNuQZ1

As the No. 1 state for film production, Georgia was home to a record 455 film and television productions in FY 18 that generated a total economic impact of $9.5 billion. I’m proud to see the film industry continue to thrive in our communities. More: https://t.co/A0ks2JjGwm https://t.co/zb7jLPjqon

SELIT North America, a German manufacturing company, will create 100 jobs and invest $45 million in a new facility in Banks County. In choosing GA, SELIT North America will enjoy our logistics infrastructure and a climate conducive to manufacturing. More: https://t.co/SBqi8ym2if

Today we celebrated the opening of the Appalachian Regional Port, a powerful new gateway to Georgia’s ports. This intermodal facility will extend the reach of our port operations to new markets and generate economic growth opportunities in northwest Georgia and beyond. https://t.co/srqR6KRtCt

As I celebrate another birthday as governor, I’m grateful for the exceptional people of Georgia, the achievements over the past eight years and my dedicated team. This opportunity to serve our great state is truly a blessing. https://t.co/SEn2KbekvW

I had the honor of serving in Congress with Sen. John McCain, where I witnessed firsthand his character and enduring patriotism. This American hero will be missed, but his lifetime of public service will long be remembered. Sandra and I send our deepest condolences to his family.

As a mark of respect for the memory and honorable service of Senator John McCain, flags will fly at half-staff until sunset on the day of his interment. We join the nation in mourning the loss of this American hero and distinguished public servant. https://t.co/tGp8bejAD3

Today I joined representatives from @BainbridgeCity and @gdecd for the groundbreaking of @TaurusUSA’s new manufacturing plant. With this investment in southwest Georgia, Taurus will create 300 new jobs and enjoy the benefits of operating in the No. 1 state for business. https://t.co/RH1vBuVkqt

.@InspireBrands will locate its new HQ in Sandy Springs, creating 1,100+ jobs & investing $32 million in Fulton Co. over the next six years. GA’s low-tax, business-friendly climate continues to cultivate our reputation as a hub for industry leaders. More: https://t.co/xN4quoIaht https://t.co/8mO5witIWx

I'm looking forward to tonight’s game between @GeorgiaStateFB and @Kennesawstfb. Good luck to the Panthers and the Owls as they kick off the 2018 season. #BeTheChange #GoldStandard https://t.co/zaXiXNdjCL

The Northwest Corridor Express Lanes, approximately 30 miles of express lanes along I-75 from Akers Mill Road to Hickory Grove Road & along I-575 from I-75 to Sixes Road, will open to southbound traffic mid-morning on Saturday, 9/8. More: https://t.co/6IGfo3RRGd @GADeptofTrans

Nisshinbo Automotive Manufacturing, Inc. will create 100 jobs and invest $72 million in an expansion of its Covington facility. We appreciate the company’s investment in GA over the last 20 years and look forward to the growth of this partnership. More: https://t.co/LgOupgDKY4 https://t.co/rtAIoiGaqj
Sandra and I wish everyone celebrating #RoshHashanah, both in Georgia and around the world, a new year of opportunity, joy and happy moments with loved ones. Shanah Tovah!

In honor of the lives lost on Sept. 11, 2001, I’ve ordered flags to fly at half-staff and call upon all Georgians to join in a moment of silence today at 8:46 a.m. May God give strength to the families who continue to grieve for loved ones lost on that most tragic day. https://t.co/id3XfTEWJj

Based on the latest 11 a.m. forecast for the southward track of Hurricane Florence after making landfall and acting on a recommendation from @GeorgiaEMA officials, I have issued an emergency declaration for all 159 counties in Georgia. Read more here: https://t.co/FmO4iELdYq

Congratulations to the 74,000 State Health Benefit Plan members who are earning green days and lowering their RealAge with @SharecareInc and @GADCH. Learn more here: https://t.co/Y52fbVGjYl #healthyGeorgia

Spoke to our Accountability Court Judges today. I thanked all 1,200+ for supporting Criminal Justice Reform! I would also like to thank @BrianKempGA for assisting me in implementing reentry reform on our licensing boards as part of our reentry portion of Criminal Justice Reform.
I am looking forward to being with @BrianKempGA on Thursday evening in Gainesville.
As sundown approaches, @GAFirstLady and I wish those observing a peaceful and meaningful #YomKippur. G’mar Chatimah Tovah.
I’m proud that every year I’ve served as Georgia’s governor, graduation rates have increased. This year, Georgia’s high school graduation rate stands at 81.6 percent, an all-time high. (1/2)

I commend Superintendent Richard Woods and @georgiadeptofed for their hard work, and I’m especially proud to have worked with the General Assembly to fully fund the QBE formula. I know @BrianKempGA will continue this positive trend and keep moving Georgia forward. (2/2)

For the fifth consecutive year, Georgia has been named the No. 1 state for business by @AreaDevelopment. Behind this ranking are hundreds of thousands of jobs for Georgia families and billions of dollars of meaningful investment in our communities. More: https://t.co/sHx7FYICLz https://t.co/Jgev3eIfqU

I commend Georgia Power, the Municipal Electric Authority of Georgia and Dalton Utilities for voting to move forward on Plant Vogtle Units 3 & 4, a critical infrastructure and economic development project. (1/3)

I also call upon Oglethorpe Power Company to reconsider its decision before walking away from from 7,000 GA jobs. Our low carbon-free electric rates allow us to remain competitive in this economic development environment, one of the many reasons GA has been named... (2/3)
...the No. 1 state for business for five straight years. The co-owners should honor their commitments and complete this project. (3/3).

I commend @GeorgiaPower, @MEAGPower, @DaltonUtilities and Oglethorpe Power Corp. for reaching an agreement to ensure that construction on Plant Vogtle Units 3 & 4 will continue. I appreciate the co-owners of this critical infrastructure and economic development… (1/3)
Judge Kavanaugh’s record is impeccable and his testimony speaks for itself. I wholeheartedly support him and encourage our nation’s senators to do the same and confirm him to the Supreme Court.

.@FloorandDecor will create 500 jobs over the next five years in the expansion and relocation of its headquarters in Cobb County. GA’s low-tax, business-friendly economic environment will continue to help Floor & Decor flourish well into the future. More: https://t.co/yH3R11RiEF https://t.co/IjcSvyh5LT
Wishing the best to our Atlanta @Braves in tonight’s first #NLDS game. Make us proud, @folty25! #ChopOn #ForEachOther https://t.co/DiKsf8aqMo
Brett Kavanaugh is one of our nation's finest legal minds and he will serve on the U.S. Supreme Court with distinction.

Based on the latest forecast for Hurricane Michael and acting on a recommendation from @GeorgiaEMA officials, I have issued an emergency declaration for 92 counties. More information and the executive order are available here: https://t.co/8uCApxveug https://t.co/zlsd3YLxsX
At 8 a.m., I activated 1,500 Georgia Guardsmen to be placed on standby and deployed as needed to areas affected by Hurricane Michael. @GeorgiaGuard

Based on the latest forecast for Hurricane Michael, I have expanded yesterday’s emergency declaration to include an additional 16 counties: Butts, Clarke, Columbia, Elbert, Greene, Jasper, Lamar, Lincoln, McDuffie, Monroe, Morgan, Oconee, Oglethorpe, Putnam, Taliaferro & Wilkes. https://t.co/zOROuRZvBo
At 10:30 a.m., I will hold a news conference to outline the state's recovery, response and restoration efforts following Hurricane Michael. Watch here: https://t.co/nLnvTBTeS9

This morning I was joined by state agency officials for a news conference to provide updates on Hurricane Michael. In case you missed it, footage from the conference is available here: https://t.co/bcGTHKGBnj

Today I announced @TCSG will establish an Aviation Academy through @chattech at the Paulding Northwest Atlanta Airport. The academy will offer training in aviation mechanics and maintenance to prepare students for jobs in GA’s aviation industry. More: https://t.co/xaWf8jOHZF

In order to better assist residents, local governments and state agencies following Hurricane Michael, I have extended the emergency declaration in 108 counties for an additional 21 days. Read the executive order here: https://t.co/cYJzFUApG1

I've always admired Sandra's dedication to Georgia’s students and I’m proud of her accomplishments as Georgia’s first lady. She inspires me in so many ways and I’m thankful for her work to share the importance of childhood literacy across our state. https://t.co/uxeeT3vyN3

Thank you, @POTUS, for your immediate attention and quick approval of GA’s request for federal aid following Hurricane Michael. Six counties have been approved for individual assistance and 31 counties have been approved for public assistance. Read more: https://t.co/AR7LmxV4ow

I have just been informed by @GeorgiaEMA that all hospitals and nursing homes within the GA footprint of Hurricane Michael are running on electric power and off of 96 generators previously in use. Thank you to @GeorgiaPower, local EMCs & @MEAGPower for your diligent efforts.

Today I met with @VP in Decatur County as we surveyed storm damage from Hurricane Michael. I’m grateful for Vice President Pence’s support and his concern for Georgia's citizens and communities during the response and recovery process. https://t.co/BzNqRRyM71

I've just been notified that @POTUS has approved the following counties for individual assistance: Crisp, Grady, Lee, Mitchell, Terrell, Thomas and Worth. Thank you to President Trump for quickly approving GA's requests for federal aid and to @VP for visiting southwest GA today.

Last night, I was notified that @POTUS approved individual assistance for Crisp, Grady, Lee, Mitchell, Terrell, Thomas and Worth counties. This is in addition to the six counties previously approved, for a total of 13 GA counties. More: https://t.co/4wXZqD8nPV (1/2)

Today I joined @TCSG representatives to celebrate the completion of the new Hall Campus of @LanierTech. This 21st-century campus will prepare thousands of students for enduring and meaningful careers in Georgia’s 21st-century workforce. Read more: https://t.co/w3iPlYei5i

Today I notified House Speaker David Ralston and Lt. Gov. @CaseyCagle that I plan to call for a special legislative session of the General Assembly, set to convene Nov. 13. Read more: https://t.co/VQmHkXagO9 (1/2)

.@wincorewindows will create 150 new jobs and invest $6.5 million in a manufacturing facility in Swainsboro. We welcome Wincore to the No. 1 state for business and look forward to the company’s success in our low-tax, business-friendly climate. Read more: https://t.co/H4Ii7JUMhE

As a mark of respect for the memory and sacrifice of @GwinnettPd Officer Antwan Toney, who was tragically killed in the line of duty, I’ve ordered flags to fly at half-staff in Gwinnett Co. and on State Capitol grounds today, the day of his funeral.  https://t.co/cvR6SlF7EO https://t.co/Z9Cb0DrAz2

SEWON America will create 100 jobs & invest $160 million in expanding its North American headquarters & manufacturing plant in LaGrange. We’re proud of the company's success and appreciate their commitment to creating even more jobs in Troup County.  More: https://t.co/0AsOObi1Ny

.@BlackRock, the world’s largest asset management firm and a technology solutions provider, has chosen Atlanta for its newest Innovation Hub and will create 1,000 career opportunities in the next several years. Read more: https://t.co/5SqPcRE3gm

ICYMI: Yesterday I visited @MeadowcreekHigh and @EJCHSEagles to congratulate new @REACHGA Scholars. As Georgia’s first needs-based college scholarship and mentorship program, REACH Georgia will serve 134 school systems and nearly 1,800 students this year. https://t.co/RVFZJPagq5

I’ve been notified that @POTUS has approved @FEMA individual assistance for an additional seven Georgia counties following Hurricane Michael: Calhoun, Clay, Laurens, Randolph, Sumter, Tift and Turner counties.

In memory of the lives lost and in honor of those affected by the tragic shooting at the Tree of Life Synagogue, flags statewide will fly at half-staff until sunset on Oct. 31. @GAFirstLady and I are praying for the victims, their loved ones and the Pittsburgh community. https://t.co/P4OthEqdiM

.@foxracingshox will create up to 800 jobs and invest up to $50 million in Georgia. Fox Factory Holding Corp.’s headquarters relocation to Georgia will produce meaningful results and create even more opportunities in the Hall County community. Read more: https://t.co/frZwLq2amK https://t.co/yHa0ujO65B

ICYMI: Yesterday @GAFirstLady & I attended the @Georgia4H Foundation’s 70th-anniversary celebration. We were honored & humbled to learn about The Nathan and Sandra Deal Leadership Endowment to support state and district officers. 4-H is training tomorrow’s leaders for GA today. https://t.co/nxyzLnFltC

I’ve been notified by @FEMA that 34 additional GA counties have been approved for Public Assistance, which provides assistance for state and local costs incurred during preparation, recovery and cleanup related to Hurricane Michael. List of counties here: https://t.co/ERpmeRVaqS https://t.co/nyA7PZhVYp

I'm saddened to hear of the passing of former Georgia Supreme Court Chief Justice Harris Hines. A brilliant legal mind and devoted public servant, Justice Hines’ more than four decades on the bench helped to make Georgia a better state.
I will make an economic development announcement at the State Capitol at 10 a.m. Watch live here: https://t.co/PmbyyHzGM1
I’m proud to announce that Georgia’s business climate has been ranked No. 1 for six consecutive years by @SiteSelection. Read more here: https://t.co/hqW7eWsjtE. https://t.co/DmnDdaoP4r

For six years now, GA’s business climate has been ranked No. 1 as people from all over the country have come here to find jobs, hope and prosperity. Since first earning this distinction, we’ve cut taxes and made even deeper investments in GA's workforce. https://t.co/hjUfm9AFiT

Here in Georgia, we have truly cultivated an economic environment that rewards hard work and innovation, generates investments in local communities and improves the overall quality of life for families. I appreciate @SiteSelection once again recognizing Georgia with this honor. https://t.co/kjYD8DZKNW

In the past eight years, we've seen the creation of roughly 750k private sector jobs and our unemployment rate is now 3.7 percent, its lowest point since 2001. I look forward to GA retaining its position as an exceptional place to work, do business and learn for years to come. https://t.co/eeyXA5J4zR

Since its inception 25 years ago, the @GeorgiaLottery has transferred $20 billion to the State of Georgia to fund educational programs. I congratulate those who helped to bring us to this milestone, as they have contributed to a brighter future for millions of Georgia’s students. https://t.co/GzPJYm2Fu4

ICYMI: Yesterday I announced GA’s business climate has been ranked No. 1 for the 6th consecutive year by @SiteSelection. This is the result of exceptional collaboration and conservative policies that attract more and more businesses to GA each year. More: https://t.co/YmRRIx9iCA https://t.co/4bFIQ9So1J

My congratulations to Gov.-elect @BrianKempGA. He and his opponent both ran passionate campaigns with very different visions about how to keep Georgia on this path of prosperity, and I believe the voters of Georgia made the correct decision in electing Brian.

In honor of those tragically and senselessly killed in Thousand Oaks, California, flags statewide will fly at half-staff until sunset on Saturday, Nov. 10. @GAFirstLady and I are praying for the victims, those injured and their families and loved ones. https://t.co/cqUV15GZr6

Today I issued the call to convene a special legislative session of the GA General Assembly, to begin on Nov. 13. The session will convene to provide emergency funding following Hurricane Michael and ratify my executive order dated July 30, 2018. More: https://t.co/OpTTtDveSq

As we once again pause to recognize the valor of our nation’s veterans, @GAFirstLady and I want to thank the more than 750,000 who call Georgia home. These men and women have bravely protected our nation, our ideals and our way of life. May God bless them and their families. https://t.co/d9gIv1addb

As a mark of respect for the memory and honorable service of retired Supreme Court of Georgia Chief Justice P. Harris Hines, flags will fly at half-staff on State Capitol grounds and all Georgia judicial buildings on Tuesday, Nov. 13, the day of his interment, until sunset. https://t.co/PCQZddPlDk

I'm saddened to hear of the passing of @GaHouseHub Rules Committee Chairman John Meadows following his battle against cancer. He was a dear friend to many of us and he will be missed. With heavy hearts, @GAFirstLady and I offer our deepest condolences to Marie and their family.

In memory of Rep. John Meadows, flags will fly at half-staff on state buildings and grounds from Saturday, Nov. 17, until sunset on Monday, Nov. 19. As a Marine, mayor of Calhoun and state representative, he admirably served Georgia and our nation, and he will be missed. https://t.co/qxjYNCcrey

Today I signed legislation from the special session of the Georgia General Assembly, including a $270 million relief package for the communities most heavily impacted by Hurricane Michael. Read more here: https://t.co/zVghWxF2Uz (1/2)
